Q1: Who was Tarcisio Fusco?
A1: Tarcisio Fusco was an Italian composer of film scores.

A2: Tarcisio Fusco was the brother of the composer Giovanni Fusco.

A3: Cecilia Fusco is the operatic soprano daughter of Tarcisio Fusco and the niece of Giovanni Fusco.

A4: Some of the films scored by Tarcisio Fusco include "Boccaccio" (1940), "Free Escape" (1951), "Abracadabra" (1952), "The Eternal Chain" (1952), and "Beauties in Capri" (1952).

A5: The film "Conspiracy of the Borgias" was scored by Tarcisio Fusco in 1959.
